intro: Piptocoma, commonly known as the silky tree or silky ash, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Euphorbiaceae. It consists of several species, primarily found in tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. These plants are characterized by their smooth, often silken-textured bark and simple, alternate leaves. The flowers are small and inconspicuous, typically clustered in cup-like structures called cyathia. Piptocoma species are often used in traditional medicine and can also be cultivated as ornamental plants due to their attractive appearance.
